meanings.definition: In a direction towards the stern of a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The sailor looked sternwards as the ship sailed away.
meanings.sent2: The airplane taxied sternwards before taking off.
meanings.sent3: The penguin waddled sternwards comically, trying to catch up with its friends.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts drifted sternwards, like a ship navigating through memories.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse beacon shone sternwards, guiding ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: Moving or facing towards the stern.
meanings.sent1: The sternwards view from the deck was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The sternwards cabin had a beautiful ocean view.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat in a sternwards pose, watching the birds intently.
meanings.sent4: His sternwards gaze made it clear he was not pleased.
meanings.sent5: The sternwards wind tousled her hair as she stood at the back of the boat.
